definition: to throw off the reins/runaway (horse)/fig. out of control
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
lit. a horse that has thrown off the reins (idiom); runaway horse/out of control
a wild horse that refuses to be bridled (a metaphor for sth that runs wild)

sentences.english: Zeal without knowledge is a runaway.
sentences.chinese: 没有知识的热情犹如脱缰野马。

sentences.english: The cowboy caught the runaway horse with a rope.
sentences.chinese: 那个牛仔用套索套住了那匹失控的脱缰野马。

sentences.english: The speed of a runaway horse counts for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 脱缰之马的速度毫无价值。

sentences.english: Her red mustang drove like a baby.
sentences.chinese: 她的红色野马脱缰而出。

sentences.english: Another spike in unemployment could well set it loose.
sentences.chinese: 失业率的再次攀升可能会让保护主义成为脱缰之马。

sentences.english: Zeal without knowledge is a runaway horse .
sentences.chinese: 缺乏知识之热情犹如脱缰之马。

sentences.english: The huge tornado kicked across the land like a wild bronco.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的龙卷风踢这片土地上宛如脱缰野马。

sentences.english: Justin and Audrey looked forward to everything and anything!
sentences.chinese: 小贝贝像是脱缰野马似的到处冲来冲去。
物价飞涨，有如脱缰之马。

sentences.english: This is, first and foremost, a crisis brought on by a runaway financial industry.
sentences.chinese: 这危机首先是归因于如脱缰之马难以控制的金融业。

sentences.english: A runaway horse had trampled on him and broken his hipbone.
sentences.chinese: 一匹脱缰的马从他身上踏过，踩断了他的髋骨。

sentences.english: The donkey brayed and tried to bolt.
sentences.chinese: 这头驴嘶叫着试图脱缰而逃。

sentences.english: He was praised for bringing up the runaway horse.
sentences.chinese: 他勒住了脱缰之马受到了表扬。

sentences.english: Z Zeal without knowledge is a runaway horse.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏知识之热心犹如脱缰之马。

sentences.english: The speed of a runaway horse count for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 脱缰之马的速度毫无价值。

sentences.english: Zeal without knowledge is a runaway horse.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏知识之热心犹如脱缰之马。

definition: a wild horse that refuses to be bridled (a metaphor for sth that runs wild)
lit. a horse that has thrown off the reins (idiom); runaway horse/out of control
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
(of mules, horses etc) to kick backward/to kick with the hind legs/fig. to flare up in anger/to display defiance
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
